boardgame.name: Siren - Simple RPG Engine
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Siren, the Simple RPG Engine, is a free and open source RPG system that aims at being simple and easy to learn without also compromising on the expressiveness of the system.

An RPG engine, much like a video game engine, is a framework on which you can build your own system. If any of the rules in this seem like they don't quite do what you need, you're free to change them or even add new ones if that better suits your campaign.

Publisher's blurb:

This rulebook covers:

Game Creation
Character Creation
Character Traits
Character Skills
Character Exploits
Combat
Character Progression
Magic Systems
Hacking the Rules


It also features an extensive list of examples for things that might be unclear to a new player.

boardgame.name: Le gare dei golem
Golem Races
boardgame.description:
Ruparstein is a land that didn’t stand out from the rest of the world until their rulers decided to export their national entertainment: the golem races. Nowadays it’s a very widespread sport with lots of racers and an anxious and unconditional audience. Skilful gnomes prepare their iron golems, necromants stitch up bodies together to create their ultimate flesh golem, dwarven conjurers sculpt stone to give birth a solid runner, and a hundred other participants wait for their call to the start line. The best runners have been called. It is now the time to make your coach a rich man and to catapult him to golem’s glory.
—description from the rulebook

The game is played by a referee and multiple racers. Players create individual golems, primarily by random roll. Play then proceeds in turns, each turn spans four distinct phases. During Phase 1, players determine initiative (who will go first that turn. During Phase 2, players move their pieces in initiative order. During Phase 3, players check for mechanical problems. During Phase 4, the referee adjusts the board as needed. The game ends when the first player - the winner - crosses the finish line.

The game is provided as a PDF rules document with suggestions on common items that can be used as game components.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Cra Diavolo, or, "That Ferocious and Insolent Toad"
boardgame.description:
Brigand or Patriot? Sworn enemy of King Tadio Polo and his Ferach allies, the legendary Cra Diavolo is the focus of resistance against the sovereign of Nepolise. Let Todoroni rebels join battle!

An unofficial expansion for Flintloque Reloaded.

—description from the rulebook
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Flintloque Reloaded

boardgame.name: The Guns of Cra Diavolo, or, "The artillery of King Polo takes flight"
boardgame.description:
"Remember to act with surprise and strike suddenly. We must destroy the King's guns without fail."

- Cra Diavolo


Scenario for Flintloque Reloaded, for two players.

—description from the rulebook
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Flintloque Reloaded

boardgame.name: The River
boardgame.description:
Only you, the mages who live in the Grey Zone, can see both incoming disasters, simultaneous and inevitable. Only you recognize the field of stars in someone's eyes as a sign of Dualism, the worship of these twin singularities. Three hundred years of history sits on your shoulders, and most people don't even believe the threat exists.

Only in the Grey Zone, between the Confederation of the Cosmic All and the Meritocratic Republic of Syble, do the four types of mages mix. The people who come to the Grey Zone are rebels, heretics, pioneers and mercenaries. Some want to build a shining city in the wastes, others just want to live another day.

At the heart of the Grey Zone lies the planet Exaltation, your home. It is the only habitable planet in the system of Deviance, ruled by the Quantum Circle, a group of mages that view the Goddess as a force of chaos. Everyone is free to use whatever substances they please, and hedonism is rampant.

But only here can you see a threat so powerful that it echoes back from the future, and only here can you stop it. If you fail, magic is doomed, the Goddess will die, and the cold war between the Confederation and the Meritocracy is going to turn very, very hot indeed.

With the power of the River of Stars and the Cosmic Deck at your fingertips, and a little luck, may you prevail!

The River features:


Galaxy-spanning science fantasy!
Diceless, non-random resolution for non-magickal tasks
Two completely different core magick systems!
Card based resolution mechanics for magick! Both magic systems use the same deck of ordinary playing cards (plus jokers) -- mages just use their hand and the Cosmic River very differently
Four Charts (playbooks), two for each type of magic, which further twist the way you control the universe: Weavers, Touched, Slicers, and Talented
Ordinary people empowered by a twin disaster echoing backward through time!
Playable with 1 GM and 2 or more additional players


Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: The Hill of Shadows
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This solo adventure allows you to play the role of a hero who lives in mysterious and magical times - a hero who goes in search of wealth, reputation and glory in ancient cities full of monsters and treasure. In order to play, you need the rules of Tunnels & Trolls and to equip yourself with paper, a pen or pencil, some 6-sided dice and a good supply of fantasy and imagination.

boardgame.name: Land & Meer
Land vs Sea
Moře a Souš
랜드 버서스 씨
boardgame.description:
Part puzzle, part game. Play as either Land or Sea (or the Cartographer in a 3 player game). Each player plays with 2 double-sided hex tiles containing a mix of land and sea shapes. They take turns placing a tile each to make a map together. Land places tiles trying to complete land areas, and Sea places tiles trying to complete sea areas. Completed areas score a point per tile; land areas for Land, sea areas for Sea. Some tiles score bonus points for whoever completes the area they are in. So players may decide to strategically complete rival’s areas to gain their bonus points. Other tiles allow players to play their second tile, or steal a player’s tile - but not their last one!

Using 2 double-sided tiles (one side always revealed and the other always hidden until played) means there is partial information to plan around, and some surprises too. Players replenish back up to 2 tiles from a choice of 2 face-up tile stacks.

The strategy of the game involves careful tile placement to score from as many land or sea areas as possible, while minimising your rivals’ opportunities to score from the tiles you play. Watch your rivals’ possible plays, and control tempo strategically with Play Again and Steal tiles. Look out for opportunities to score valuable bonus points in your and your rivals’ areas. Carefully select tiles as you replenish your hand to prepare for your next turn.

The game ends once the last tile is placed. The player or team with the most points wins.

The basic Land vs Sea game is simple enough for light / family gamers. After you have played the basic game, you can unlock more scoring options on the tiles to add surprising depth:
1. Mountain & Coral scoring - score for cumulative chains of connected Mountain (Land) / Coral (Sea) sections.
2. Caravan & Ship scoring - score for Caravans & Ships added to Trade Routes on the map, and score each Trade Route you have majority in (more Caravans scores the Trade Route for Land, more Ships for Sea) at the end of the game.
3. Waypoints - bonus points you can place on the map to entice cooperation, or score for yourself.

2, 3 & 4 player modes:
You can play head to head with 2 players, or with 4 players in teams using the basic rules and any of the additional scoring options. 4 player games use Waypoints to prevent alpha players directly instructing their partner.

The challenging 3 player mode uses all of the additional scoring options in a more asymmetric game. The Cartographer scores by connecting Mountain and Coral sections, and all players compete for bonus points and Trade Route scoring.

-description from publisher

Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 15 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.
NIS

English edition. Like new, played one time. Language independent game.
Contact me for the exact shipping costs: Belgium or The Netherlands: €4-7 with BPost/DPD/PostNL other European countries: €9 - €13 (depending on the destination) worldwide: €20 The shipping quotes above are shipping without tracking and no insurance. Contact me for other shipping options or combined shipping.
Payment: European bank transfer or Paypal (buyer pays fees)

£3 UK postage
PayPal friends and family

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Missions Pack
boardgame.description:
With the rulebook now adopting the revised victory conditions from the old More Missions pack, we've updated it (now just called the Missions pack) to reflect this. We've also added the missions from the Experimental Missions pack as well, consolidating them all in one place. Includes 6 print and play cards.

The pack contains Twenty missions: • Annihilation • Breakthrough • Bridgehead • Contact • Cornered • Counterattack • Dust Up • Dogfight • Encounter • Encirclement • Encounter • Escape • Free For All • Escape • Fighting Withdrawl • Free for All • Gauntlet • Killing Ground • No Retreat • Outflanked • Scouts Out • Spearpoint • Vanguard •

Each mission has a double page telling you how to play the mission and detailing the mission special rules. You can either print each mission out on a single piece of paper (front and back) or print it as a booklet with each mission on facing pages.

The Battle Plans mission selector allow you and your opponent to choose the most appropriate missions for your forces. Each player chooses a plan (Prepared Attack, Hasty Attack, or Defend) and then you look up a table to see which mission to play and who will be the attacker.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

boardgame.name: Magna Roma: Dominus
boardgame.description:
In Dominus, players will be fighting for control of the Europe and North African territories. To do this, players will be able to either use the military symbols combination or the prestige symbol combination.

Players will do this until the end of the game, and the player with the majority of armies in a territory, will win the first place in that territory and score most for whatever the condition is in that territory. We should also note that this board replaces the military board in the base game.

In Portus, your neighborhoods will be able to craft goods which you can then export from your port!

Once you think you have enough goods for export, you can simply turn over those goods to the supply and score prestige depending on what types of goods you have exported! Sometimes, some goods will cost you population, so you need to plan carefully for such occasion.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Magna Roma

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Skjut dom i huvudet
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The core rulebook for the apocalyptic zombie game set in Gothenburg, Sweden. The book resembles a used VHS cassette.

boardgame.name: Elongo
boardgame.description:
Elongo is a colourful and skillful 2-4 player tile game that reflects the life of the Maasai tribes of Kenya and Tanzania.

Players take turns laying 2 tiles and features on the tiles may be claimed or abandoned. Players compete for tile features that allow them to place their Zebu cattle, sheep and goats when features are completed.

The player who places all of their stock of animals in an enclosure is the winner.

—description from publisher

This is a tile laying game. 2 tiles are laid in each players turn, .

boardgame.name: Love Links
boardgame.description:
Love Links is a 2-4 player game that lets players create and wear bracelets made of precious metals and jewels.

Players place 2 bracelet links during their turn, joining to links already placed by other players according to the properties of links already played.

If a bracelet is completed then the player receives points according to length of the bracelet, the metal in the bracelet, the jewels and its other features. And the player receives the bracelet to wear!

—description from the designer

The player with the most points after all bracelet links have been played wins.

boardgame.name: L.A.M.A.: 3 Gry w 1
boardgame.description: 3 in 1: L.A.M.A., L.A.M.A. Party Edition and L.A.M.A. Dice

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: This Polish edition includes 3 games in 1 box: Standard Lama, Lama dice and Lama party

boardgame.name: Mafia de Cuba: Mil Pesos Bill
boardgame.description: New element to be integrated into the Mafia's vault in Cuba. This object has no official effect. It is more of a collector's item than a real game mechanic. However, it can be associated with a diamond, since it has a financial value.

boardgame.name: Triple-T
boardgame.description:
The game board is nine tic-tac-toe fields in a 3x3 grid. Whoever manages to lay a line of three fields wins - but only one of the nine quadrants. It's not that easy at all: The opponent determines which quadrant you are allowed to play on with his previous move. In this way he can prevent one of his lines from being interrupted.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Cards Against Humanity: Hidden Gems
boardgame.description:
The Hidden Gems Bundle is an expansion pack to Cards Against Humanity.

Contains six different themed packs and 10 all-new cards.

Contents: 190 cards total (150 White cards + 40 Black Cards).
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Cards Against Humanity
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Cards Against Humanity: Non-denominational Seasons Greetings Pack

listing.notes: weight: 422 grams + packaging

boardgame.name: Lucky Cat
boardgame.description: Collect a winning combination of Lucky Cats in this colourful, cat collecting card game from Ridley's Games! The aim of the game is to collect a winning combination of Lucky Cats before the other players to win a round. The first person to win two rounds wins the game! There are 2 winning combinations of cats: 7 of the same numbered cats in different colours or cats numbered 1-7 of the same colour. Contains instructions, 65 game cards, 4 reference cards, packaged in a novelty Lucky Cat shaped case.

boardgame.name: The Goblins Lair
A Toca dos Goblins
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

“Constant attacks have been carried out in the forest region near Holyrock. The small town of Taveiro Village was raided by a group of Goblins that are plundering the agricultural region near the city. There is suspicion that there is a lair of these beings near the village, but so far, no one has been able to find the place. The mayor of the city is hiring adventurers to discover and eliminate this band of Goblins. It offers a big reward, in addition to allowing the booty found with these beings to own the heroes. Are you ready for the challenge? ”

Goblins Lair is a “One Shot” style adventure, one that you can play in an afternoon or fit into your larger campaign.
This adventure is designed for up to 4 players from level 1 to 3. We recommend using the basic BX books or the old D&D books. Have Fun!

boardgame.name: Peter Powell's Pop Trivia
boardgame.description:
The Board is a track from 1975 up to Number 1. Players must answer trivia questions on the UK pop scene for 1960 to 1986. Up to 4 players get their own question book. There are 2,500 questions in the game which is a good number and enhances replay ability.
Before the start each player writes down 10 song titles and keeps that secret.

As you move up the board (usually by rolling a die) you will land on one of 9 types of squares.

IN CONCERT - Pick another player. Pick a number from 1 to 10. That player now has to mime the title on his secret list with the number you chose. You get 2 minutes to get the song title.
BLANK SPACE - You are told a question. Get it right, you can have another turn. Get it wrong and you end your turn.
COVER VERSION - Choose another player and select a number from 1 to 10. That player now reveals the song on his list. You must then sing two consecutive lines in the song. Get it right and you get another turn, Get it wrong and you end your turn.
HYPE - Guilty of illegal song placement. End your turn and go back to Start.
BAN - Having a song banned from the radio is a sure sign of selling lots of copies. Move up 10 spaces on the board.
END OF TURN/FREE GO - No question to answer and continue your turn.
REMIX - Ask a question to any other player from your question book. If that player he stays where hew is. If he gets it wrong he moves 6 spaces down the board.
THE TOP TEN - No dice movement. Instead you answer a question correctly to move 1 space up the board. Get it wrong, you stay where you are. If you are on Square Number 2 you must answer 2 consecutive questions to get to Number One. If you get there first, you are the winner.

The game was an advertising item for Pepsi.
Peter Powell (b.1951) was a very popular BBC Disc-Jockey. His image is on the cover.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Katzekartonen
boardgame.description:
In Katzekartonen, two players compete to end the game with the most cats in the boxes of their color. Play occurs in two phases: first, there is the "Experimental Design." Place boxes of your color into the lab room game board. But be careful, your opponent may place their boxes inside yours, Changing an opportunity for you to score to one for them.

Once all the boxes are placed, it's time for Cat Herding! Try to place more cats in your boxes than your opponent. But cats are tricky, and rarely stay where they're placed! Place a cat beside another, and it will jump to another box, which may cause the next cat to jump, which can cause the next... It could be a whole cascade of chaotic cats. Can you tame the chaos to herd more cats I to your boxes and force your opponent to cause a "Cuckoo Kitty" and end the game?

This game utilizes a unique take on the tile-laying genre by adding a layering component and a secondary movement round. Its "strategic chaos" gameplay makes it fun for veteran "crunchy" players and new gamers alike.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Nut Hunt
boardgame.description:
Nut Hunt! A Game of Territorial Squirrels. Is a Network or Connections game where players complete runs of squirrels and squirrel nests. The game has elements of hand management, random movement, and area control.

The game is played on a hex board with 19 tiles, each with unique place names. The tiles are randomized between each game for maximum replayability.

What differentiates Nut Hunt is the Fox which roams the board at random. When the fox encounters squirrels, they must flee into adjacent hexes. The fox can foil plans, be used to disrupt opponents, or be worked into a master strategy scattering your own squirrels into more advantageous hexes.

Every player turn has two mandatory actions:
1) Move the fox (and scatter squirrels)
2) Forrage for nuts

Then the player may take any one of three optional actions:
1) Recruit a squirrel (pay nuts to place a squirrel in a hex)
2) Hassle the fox (taunt the fox so that it moves into an adjacent territory)
3) Scout for new objectives

Squirrel nests are created when a player controls three squirrels in the same territory. Nests are immune to fleeing from the fox.

The game ends when a player places their 4th Nest. Points are scored based on runs completed (and lost for those failed), as well as number of nests built.

Nut Hunt! A Game of Territorial Squirrels is fast to learn with quick set up and tear down. The game has simple mechanics but strategic complexity.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: 大怪獣ヴェナタス VS 強欲な異能建築家 (Dai kaijuu Venatas vs Goyouku na inou-kenchikuka)
boardgame.description:
大怪獣ヴェナタス VS 強欲な異能建築家 (Daikaiju Venatas vs Goyoku na inou-kenchikuka) is a game from Japan with players constructing properties and sending monsters to destroy the opponents' buildings.

Over 6 rounds, players place cubes in the different sectors of the city. As buildings are constructed, the land prices rise in the sectors. Then the players send Godzilla crashing around, which brings down land prices. Then they sell the buildings if they have the matching cards in hand. Unsold buildings stay in place, risking destruction next turn.

There are caps on the number of buildings to be built or sold, and the cap rises over the game.

At the end of the game, the player who's made the most profit is the winner.
user summary
boardgame.boardgamedesigner: Kuma Guma Restaurant Manager (熊熊飯店 店長)

boardgame.name: Gryningens beskyddare
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Läget i Pyrisamfundet är mer desperat än någonsin. Svarta moln hopar sig i alla väderstreck, och Samfundets själva existens är hotad av mörka krafter med rötter ända tillbaka till den Gamla tiden. Men ännu är allt inte förlorat. En liten skara antihjältar i Hindenburgs gränder har ännu chansen att och rädda dagen och slutligen befria Pyrisamfundet från forntidens bojor.

Gryningens beskyddare är en episk kampanjmodul till rollspelet Mutant: Hindenburg. Genom att spela äventyren mellan dessa pärmar kommer ni att kunna avslöja monumentala hemligheter som drivit fram det nuvarande krigstillståndet i Pyrisamfundet och avgöra rikets framtid. Hur Gryningens beskyddare än slutar kommer Pyri aldrig att vara sig likt igen.

boardgame.name: Monsters of Aquilae Volume 1 (DCC)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monsters of Aquilae is an enormous bestiary consisting of more than 200 brand-new monsters.

Each of these monsters is designed you can use immediately in any campaign setting and any plot or story.

Each monster features all of the following:

4 complete statblocks
Physical description
Encounter behavior
Story hooks & quest snippets for introducing the monster into your game
Actions and Special Qualities
Environmental description
Lore: Commonly-known information about the monster, as well as Expanded Lore, only available to a PC who passes Knowledge or related checks to uncover the info
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Snack Parrows Intergalaktiska Rymdbyrå
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

I Snack Parrows intergalaktiska rymdbyrå ligger fokuset på fantasifullt berättande! Här kan spelarna ta sig an olika uppdrag, möta märkliga varelser som humfurkar och ankpirater, eller utforska de olika planeterna i Polsystemet. Kanske de till och med stöter på några robotkaniner?

De som läst böckerna kommer att känna igen sig i miljöerna, men det är inget som är ett krav för att få spela. Det går att spela karaktärer ur böckerna, eller att skapa helt egna.

Snack Parrows intergalaktiska reklambyrå är skriven av Camilla Linde, författaren till böckerna om Snack Parrows, och Daniel Lehto. För illustrationerna står David Téczely, Snack Parrows ordinarie illustratör.

boardgame.name: Hamster Highlight: Four Flumphs in a Trenchoat!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Reports indicate that a large creature resembling an ogre has been wandering the countryside, but instead of terrifying the populace, it . . . heals people?

Introducing EMKH, a collective of four psychically fused flumphs in a flimsy disguise, who wants nothing more than to bring healing and peace to everyone it meets!

boardgame.name: Kirsten Bentley & Heinrich Breit
boardgame.description: From publisher blurb:
boardgame.rpgseries: Official Handbook of the Amazing Universe

boardgame.name: Carnage Amongst the Depraved (World-Walker Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are trolls, close to the city. Why? What are their plans? And when will they choose to start acting directly against the humans and elves who live in the region? Perhaps the best question might be will the party be able to do something about it? In this adventure, that is the challenge - Can they find a way to beat the trolls, because simply facing them sword to sword is not going to work against soldiers this fierce.

Looking for some old school style adventuring? You know - The kind inside dungeons, where the exploration was still part of the fun? Looking to find challenge in the monster enemies, the traps, and how it all fits together into a mission that makes some sense? Looking for ideas and inspiration that will get you excited about being a game master again? Yep, you found it!

Carnage Amongst the Depraved is a restoration of the fifth adventure module Board Enterprises published back in the early days. Out of print for years, we brought it back, but this is a far better version of an already cool quest. Not only have we gone through the mission itself and added a bunch of commentary about how to make the encounters work (meaning work easier for a game master), but we’re giving far clearer descriptions of the enemies, the environment, and stuff / loot.

Probably more important to many of you, this mission now contains the enemies in both Legend Quest and die-20 stats. We know that not all of you play by our rules, so we’ve included the stat blocks that will allow you to run this mission in our rules, die-20 rules, or your home grown. After all, quests are about a whole lot more than just how many points it takes to kill the monsters - there needs to be some story, a setting, and most of all strategies.

But this isn’t just an adventure! We’ve put Carnage Amongst the Depraved inside one of our Small Bites editions. That means you’ll get the mission, but also world building ideas, the setting outside the dungeon, story ideas, new magic items, and all the rest! Is there more? This is the free version - the World Walker edition. If your GM is going to run this mission for you, you can download this free version and learn what you need to know about the setting, without revealing anything about the mission itself. Now you won’t need all that exposition when you show up to play.

As many of you already know, Carnage Amongst the Depraved is a part of our massive campaign setting The Endless Dungeon. From here your party can go on to bigger and tougher missions, until they are ready to challenge one of the toughest adventures of them all. But this, like the others, has a fully designed start if you decide not to use it as part of the quest chain.

Pick this up to see what all the noise is about! When you see how much you like it, either you or your GM can grab the Game Masters’ edition and run the mission for your party. How often do you get to preview an adventure to see if you like it?

This supplement contains 16 pages of content, compared to the full (GM) version which contains 59 pages.

boardgame.name: Carnage Amongst the Depraved (Game Master's Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are trolls, close to the city. Why? What are their plans? And when will they choose to start acting directly against the humans and elves who live in the region? Perhaps the best question might be will the party be able to do something about it? In this adventure, that is the challenge - Can they find a way to beat the trolls, because simply facing them sword to sword is not going to work against soldiers this fierce.

Looking for some old school style adventuring? You know - The kind inside dungeons, where the exploration was still part of the fun? Looking to find challenge in the monster enemies, the traps, and how it all fits together into a mission that makes some sense? Looking for ideas and inspiration that will get you excited about being a game master again? Yep, you found it!

Carnage Amongst the Depraved is a restoration of the fifth adventure module Board Enterprises published back in the early days. Out of print for years, we are bringing it back, but this is a far better version of an already cool quest. Not only have we gone through the mission itself and added a bunch of commentary about how to make the encounters work (meaning work easier for a game master), but we’re giving far clearer descriptions of the enemies, the environment, and stuff / loot.

Probably more important to many of you, this mission now contains the enemies in both Legend Quest and die-20 stats. We know that not all of you play by our rules, so we’ve included the stat blocks that will allow you to run this mission in our rules, die-20 rules, or your home grown. After all, quests are about a whole lot more than just how many points it takes to kill the monsters - there needs to be some story, a setting, and most of all strategies.

But this isn’t just an adventure! We’ve put Carnage Amongst the Depraved inside one of our Small Bites editions. That means you’ll get the mission, but also world building ideas, the setting outside the dungeon, story ideas, new magic items, and all the rest! Is there more? Of course there is! We have also released a free version - the World Walker edition. If you want to run this mission, you can tell your players to download the free version and it will give them notes they need about the setting, without revealing anything about the mission itself. See, we even took care of the exposition section for you, so you can get right into the gaming when everyone shows up.

One last “but wait there’s more”: As many of you already know, Carnage Amongst the Depraved is a part of our massive campaign setting The Endless Dungeon. From here your party can go on to bigger and tougher missions, until they are ready to challenge one of the toughest adventures of them all. But this, like the others, has a fully designed start if you decide not to use it as part of the quest chain.

boardgame.name: Maiden's Inn Massacre
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 5 characters of level 8

When wizards go to war, it is the common folk who suffer most. But when an aging assassin-turned-innkeeper is also caught in the crossfire, heroes are needed to prevent an all-out massacre. Can the characters negotiate a truce among the opposing factions, or will the stand-off at the Maiden’s Inn end in tragedy?

Indrazma the Unforgiving is the city’s foremost collector of arcane tomes.

The moniker “Unforgiving”? Turns out it’s well-deserved, as Daharo the greedy, former apprentice is about to find out.

Add a retired assassin, copious amounts of explosive alchemical supplies and a party of adventurers.

What could go wrong in this highly volatile situation?

boardgame.name: Akashic Classes: Volur
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Veiled with Hidden Power!
Akashic Classes: Volur is the latest volume in our new series of class-focused player supplements for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, this time focusing on the mystic powers of akasha. Within this volume you will find the aforementioned class, the volur, which utilizes a connection with a spirit of the akashic record to utilize veils to bolster themselves and to blight their foes. This book also features brand new Brand Veils which are placed on your foes to curse them with debilitating effects, and rules for Akashic Spirits, a new form of familiar available to the volur! You can evolve your spirit companions within Circles of the Cycle, Elements, Wilds, and the World, with Aspects like Life and Death, Growth and Decay, Fire and Ice, and nearly a dozen more! Meanwhile, you can garb yourself in mystical accoutrements coalesced from the essence of magic itself, with expanded veilweaving rules and 16 new veils like traitor’s mark, chronomancer’s jinx, veilhex, and bloodvine embrace!

boardgame.name: Sullasara's Spells of Unrivalled Utility
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When Teclis decided to instruct the humans of the Empire in the use of magic, there was much grumbling. Some thought it madness; while others saw the grim necessity of it. However, the Elf High Mage Sullasara saw it as an excellent opportunity to educate the Empire’s unfortunates in the ways of their betters. To this end, she scribed a short grimoire of useful magics, taken from each of the eight lores taught at the colleges Teclis founded, and had it translated into Reikspeil. Sullasara chose spells that she felt were safe, useful, and would have as little use on the battlefield as possible.

The Wizards of the Empire have been abusing these magics ever since.

Sullasara’s Spells of Unrivalled Utility is a fascinating collection of 24 new spells, three for each of the eight lores of colour magic practised in the Empire. These spells are designed to provide utility outside of combat, but no doubt canny wizards will put them to use in ways their creator could not have envisioned. This PDF also includes each spell as a printable spell card, so you can easily add them to the magic already found in the WFRP rulebook.

Sullasara’s Spells of Unrivalled Utility is the perfect addition to any player Wizard’s arsenal, but can also be of use to GMs in creating NPC adversaries with unexpected magical abilities.

boardgame.name: Path of Light and Shadow: Solstice
Senda de Luz y Sombra: Solsticio
boardgame.description:
After many winters of war, the Realms lay in ruin. The feud of the deposed heirs to the throne has spilled out across the sea, reaching the forgotten shores of the Hinterlands. There in the abandoned cities and broken temples, relics of impossible power await. But so do their keepers, the ancient race Viratis that walk between the light and the shadow.

In this expansion you will explore megalith ruins on a new island, utilize magical relics, and command new forces that move between Cruelty and Mercy for powerful effects.

Inside the box you can find new player cards for existing factions, a new Region deck for the Hinterlands that include the new Viratis faction, and special map Regions that contain powerful Megaliths instead of towers.

-description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Path of Light and Shadow

boardgame.name: The Treasure Trials
boardgame.description:
The Treasure Trials are an ancient contest to obtain four keys to unlock the final prize. Treasure hunters will journey through an island jungle while overcoming dangerous trials, uncovering magical artifacts, setting traps, and undoubtedly turning to thievery.

Keys are primarily obtained through mini-game trials such as racing to stack all of your dice, attempting to roll a six within six seconds, and knocking over a tower of dice! You can also obtain keys by buying them off the market with the coins you find or steal.

You group of 2-6 treasure hunters will learn the game quickly, but playstyles will emerge as differing strategies are claimed. Will you protect your coins to buy keys off the market? Hone your skills as a thief? Or seek advantages to aid you in the trials?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Agents of Kingdom
boardgame.description:
What kind of game is it?

The game is played by moving the pieces on the board in the manner of Shogi or Chess. 7 different secret orders are dealt face down, and the player who moves his pieces the fastest to fulfill his secret order wins the game. The secret orders can be as simple as occupying three red squares (which can be occupied by moving pieces and entering red squares), or as complex as having the hero piece, which is one's alter ego, defeated first among all players (usually, the player loses when the hero piece is defeated).

Therefore, for example, if you forcibly aim at a red square that is not necessary, other players may find out about your secret order and interfere with it, and if you unnaturally leave the pieces that protect the heroic pieces empty, they will also find out and it will be difficult to achieve your secret order. The key to the game is how to approach the secret mission secretly and inconspicuously.

The board may be unfavorable, but...

There are two special squares on the board: the red square is a recruiting base and the yellow square is a treasure base. When you occupy a recruiting base, you can add your own pieces to it every turn. When you occupy a treasure base, you can draw strategy cards that allow you to perform special moves such as double moves.

These recruiting bases and treasure bases are the conditions for many secret orders, so you have to guess whether other players are simply occupying them to gain an advantage in the game, or whether they are actually close to achieving their secret orders. Of course, you can use your own pieces and strategy cards to interfere with other players, but it is also very effective to make use of the fact that the secret orders are undisclosed to encourage other players to interfere without getting your hands dirty.

In addition, since all players want to have a useful base of troops and treasure, alliances will be formed early in the game, either by using pieces and strategy cards to fight for the base, or by spontaneously forming alliances to share the base. There are no penalties for betraying alliances, so don't hesitate to betray an alliance if you think you can fulfill a secret order and get closer to victory.

Repeatable and fun!

At the start of the game, in addition to the secret mission card, seven different hero cards are dealt to the player in public, and each of the seven heroes has various characteristics: some are good at power play by sending out many pieces, some are good at trick play by making use of strategy cards, and some are good at slowly accumulating strength in a safe area. Since seven types of secret mission cards are combined with these unique heroes, the fighting style changes every time, so you can enjoy the game for a long time without getting bored.

Also, the initial placement of the hero pieces is determined by the hero cards. It is quite advantageous if the initial placement is close to the base which is the victory condition. However, if other players think that the victory condition is too early, you will be attacked from many directions or receive a concentrated fire of strategy cards, and it is not easy to win. Try to avoid letting your opponent know your victory condition.

On the other hand, you will be at a disadvantage if the base that is the victory condition is far from your initial placement. Use all possible means to achieve a victory on thin ice, such as boldly attacking and destroying the opponent's heroic pieces, making alliances with other players using the opponent with an advantage on the board as a common virtual enemy, or forcing them to fight each other.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Superfight Superchest
boardgame.description: A storage box for Superfight that can contain 1200 cards, and that comes with two hundred new cards.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Superfight

boardgame.name: Random Fun Generator
boardgame.description: Random Fun Generator consists of rules for 26 fast-playing dice games. Games are for 2 or more players and require 6-sided dice, as few as 2 total and up to 10 per player. Most games do not require anything beyond a pencil and paper for scoring.
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Random Fun Generator

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Serpent Kings (Olde Swords Reign)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Written by Skerples and converted to Olde Swords Reign by S. Myers.
A free tutorial dungeon adventure for 1st to 2nd level characters.

boardgame.name: A Crucible for Silver
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Crucible For Silver is a simplified OSR rpg system with a grid based inventory, rules for running a mercenary company, 1d100 weird backgrounds, 1d100 weird trinkets, and 36 spells that scale with the caster's level.

boardgame.name: Diddly
boardgame.description:
On a turn, draw a card to replace a card. Match cards to make them worth Diddly. There’s nothing to it!

When a round ends, the points of any unmatched cards are added to your score. The player with the lowest score after five rounds WINS!

But wait, there’s more! (Or is it less?)

Special cards let you peek at your face-down cards, dig through the discard pile, halve the value of a card, or make an instant match.

Look Ma, no hands! Cards are played in front of a player not held in a hand. Diddly is a game the whole family can enjoy.

To win Diddly, stop at nothing… or as close as you can!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Nightshift: Choose Your Path and Face the Consequence
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Do you prefer your gamebooks to have less dice and more gore? Welcome to the Nightshift! Normally, you turn up at the hospital at 9PM and prepare to face whatever comes through the door. You’ve patched up gunshot wounds, plated broken bones and drained abscesses. Sometimes, you’ve spent the entire night watching TV, feeling bored and just willing the phone to ring. Waiting for something to happen. But what if something did happen? What would you do if your ordinary routine just turned upside down? In this adventure, you are not a hero. You’re just a hospital worker who’s plunged into an interactive battle against demons, witches and time itself. You're caught in the middle of a nightmare but will you be able to use your wits and survive? There’s a difference with this adventure though. There's no dice to throw and no battles to fight. You won't get through by being lucky and you definitely have no spells or swords. What will get you through to the end of the nightshift is what you already have—knowledge, skills, memory and a pencil—the best advice is that you make notes of all the evidence and hints you find! You just might make it out if you can piece together the clues and figure out the puzzles. We'll see you on the other side!
boardgame.rpg: Nightshift: Choose Your Path and Face the Consequence

boardgame.name: A Day in Paris
boardgame.description:
You and a friend are visiting Europe, and have different ideas about how to explore Paris’ many tourist attractions in the single day you have. It may sound easy, but Paris is a major city, bustling with tourists and traffic. Your normal means of traversing the connections between attractions is the hop-on-hop-off bus, but if you want to travel faster you can take an expensive taxi from time to time. At each attraction you’ll enjoy spending time exploring, sometimes for a short period and sometimes a longer stay. You’ll be distracted by delicious French pastries, however, and all day long you won’t be able to ignore any patisserie you see. Sip an espresso with your treats, but don’t forget that your goal is to have a better sightseeing experience than your opponent – and both quantity and quality will count toward victory!

GAMEPLAY
On a player’s turn, he/she may take one of the following actions:

• Play one or more cards to travel along the connection lines on the board, from one attraction to another.
• Play one card to explore an attraction.
• Discard one card.

There are three types of connections between attractions: short, medium and long. To move along a connection, a player plays one or more cards from his hand and uses its time symbols to meet the connection’s requirements. Once at an attraction, a player can explore it via melding a matching card from his hand. A few special actions and "long waits" at some attractions add randomness and flavor.

COMPONENTS
• 1 Game Board
• 54 Action Cards
• 20 Wooden Cubes
• 1 Set of Chits
• 2 Player Tokens
• 1 Rules booklet

-description from designer

boardgame.description:
The Codex is a web-based publication that highlights rules updates and showcases new content for Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition and its Prophecy of Kings expansion.

This volume includes:
3 New Relic Cards
Faction Reference Cards
Alliance Reference Cards
Alliance Game Variant

boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Twilight Imperium: Fourth Edition

boardgame.name: Tomb in the Depths
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Tomb in the Depths, a group of level-5 adventurers learns of a fabled location. A ship cemetery that somehow attracts more and more vessels and crafts to it. Pirates and sailors avoid it at all costs, but rumor has it that a thousand-year-old vault rests at the bottom of the sea, right under the crashed and stranded ships. Fishermen and locals have vague rumors and twisted stories about the origins of this place. There is a gnome named Farris Zamilikus who seems to know more of the truth...

The adventurers are up for a great surprise when they realize their task might be more dangerous than expected. Besides the local fauna and the environmental complications, the vault is not abandoned, and while it is loaded with treasure, it is also a king's tomb. The individual that rests there won't let some pesky grave-robbers steal what's rightfully theirs.

boardgame.name: Draci v práci
Flamecraft
Lángművesek
Мастера пламени
boardgame.description:
Artisan dragons, the smaller and magically talented versions of their larger (and destructive) cousins, are sought by shopkeepers so that they may delight customers with their flamecraft. You are a Flamekeeper, skilled in the art of conversing with dragons, placing them in their ideal home and using enchantments to entice them to produce wondrous things. Your reputation will grow as you aid the dragons and shopkeepers, and the Flamekeeper with the most reputation will be known as the Master of Flamecraft.

In Flamecraft, 1-5 players take on the role of Flamekeepers, gathering items, placing dragons and casting enchantments to enhance the shops of the town. Dragons are specialized (bread, meat, iron, crystal, plant and potion) and the Flamekeepers know which shops are the best home for each. Visit a shop to gain items and a favor from one of the dragons there. Gathered items can be used to enchant a shop, gaining reputation and the favors of all the dragons in the shop. If you are fortunate enough to attract fancy dragons then you will have opportunities to secure even more reputation.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Chrome Hammer Ascension: A Cyber Fantasy Solo Skirmish Campaign Game
boardgame.description:
Sometimes you just want an elf and a ghoul to go shoot at each other in the cyberized back alleys of neo-berlin.

Welcome to Chrome Hammer Ascension.

In this solo campaign game your gang of punks will attempt to take on the mega-corporations of the ascended world. Dragon CEOs run pharmaceutical companies while flame demons prowl the back alleys and kobold zealots trade shots with an elf hacker.

CHA features a full campaign game where your punks gain experience, find new cool gear and hopefully don't end up face down in a rainy alley when a security guard finally frags them.

Random events, extensive lists of gear and abilities and a huge array of creatures are present in the book, allowing for you to really immerse yourself in the world of cyber fantasy.

The combat system is based on Squad Hammer and Chrome Hammer allowing fast, colorful combat without being bogged down by complex rules, letting you focus on the scenario you are playing and the enemies you are facing down.

Intended from the ground up as a solo game, all you need is a handful of miniatures to get started doing battle on the blood-slick streets, in VR space or the astral plane! Each campaign sees you fighting the mega-corps leading to an epic showdown against their monster CEO.

All of this is supported by included random tables to add flavor to the game experience.

This is a fantastic opportunity to use some figures you have not had a chance to use yet, plan some wild new paint jobs or conversions or bring some beloved old favorites back.


The core mechanics use a 2D6, pick highest roll to determine how many characters can activate each turn with characters being able to perform an array of actions.
Ranged combat is resolved with a 2D6 roll trying to exceed a target number, with enemies in close range being permitted to return fire.
Physical injury, squad casualties and morale is all merged into a single damage score, which can be reduced through the use of certain actions. This allows a fast-playing but tactical feeling experience.
Mechanics are included for stealth missions, spells and more.



The rules are intended for solo play and are stand-alone. You do not need a copy of Chrome Hammer or Squad Hammer to play.
The intended play space is roughly 3 x 3 feet though smaller tables are manageable.
Game scale is agnostic but will play fine in both 15mm and 28mm+.
Record sheets are included.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: SALBAGE
boardgame.description:
SALBAGE is a 2 player abstract postcard game from Japan. The postcard has the rules on one side, and the playing area on the other (two are sold in a pack).

Each player has three dice of their own colour. They take turns rolling and placing the dice on the 3*3 grid. Each space has an instruction, which allow the player to change the dice number or move it around.

The winner is the first player to get all three of their dice to show all odd or all even numbers.
user summary

boardgame.name: Northern Democracy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

At odds again, the Androma brothers compete with one another for the speakership of Good Mead. Despite their efforts, the residents have begun switching their preferences in favor of a dark horse candidate from outside of town. Meanwhile, a cleric from the south has arrived to investigate the appearance of a necromancer in the area and becomes involved with the political campaign.

A four-hour adventure for TIER 1 characters (APL 3).

Includes 4 digital maps for use in virtual tabletop software, and an extended homebrew version incorporating additional content. A1-size maps for printing coming soon.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Cold Eyes of Terror
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An encounter with an insane kobold leads the adventurers into a deep mystery concealed within dark caverns. Can the adventurers unravel the clues to understand what horrors await them?

This is a four hour, Dungeoncraft Adventure for Plague of Ancients (Adventurers League Season 10). The adventure is for characters level 1 - 4 (Tier 1) and is set at APL 3. The adventure brings the party to a mine in Termalaine to unravel a series of clues drawn onto scattered parchment papers.

This product includes a PDF version of the adventure, a .zip of the maps and handouts and a Fantasy Grounds .mod file of the adventure.
